title: Looks aren't everything. Believe me, I'm a model - Cameron Russell

multiple-choice.question: What does the speaker attribute as the main reason for her becoming a model?

options.label: A
options.text: Her extensive experience in the fashion industry.

options.label: B
options.text: Winning a genetic lottery and being a recipient of a legacy of beauty standards that favor her physical characteristics.

options.label: C
options.text: Being scouted by a modeling agency due to her exceptional talent.

multiple-choice.question: What advice does the speaker give to young girls who aspire to be models?

options.label: A
options.text: With hard work and dedication, they can definitely become models.

options.label: B
options.text: They can be anything they want to be, but being a model is not a reliable career path and is largely outside of their control.

options.label: C
options.text: They need to have a specific body type to be a model.

options.label: D
options.text: They should focus on developing other skills to increase their chances of success.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what role does retouching play in the final image of a photo shoot?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the most important aspect of the photo shoot.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a small component, and the final image is a construction of many professionals, including stylists, makeup artists, and photographers.

options.label: C
options.text: It is not used at all in the modeling industry.

options.label: D
options.text: It is only used to correct minor flaws.

multiple-choice.question: How does the speaker respond to people who ask if she receives free items as a model?

options.label: A
options.text: She says yes, she receives free items all the time, and it's one of the best perks of being a model.

options.label: B
options.text: She says yes, but the free items she receives are often a result of her physical appearance, not who she is as a person.

options.label: C
options.text: She says no, she doesn't receive free items at all.

options.label: D
options.text: She says it depends on the situation.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the impact of societal beauty standards on young girls?

options.label: A
options.text: It has a positive impact, promoting self-confidence and self-esteem.

options.label: B
options.text: It has a negative impact, with many young girls experiencing body dissatisfaction and insecurity.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no impact at all.

multiple-choice.question: How does the speaker describe her experience as a model?

options.label: A
options.text: She says it's amazing and fabulous, and she loves every minute of it.

options.label: B
options.text: She says it's not always happy and fulfilling, and that she struggles with insecurity and the pressure to conform to unrealistic beauty standards.

options.label: C
options.text: She says it's a mix of both.

options.label: D
options.text: She says it's not worth it.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's main message to her audience?

options.label: A
options.text: She wants them to be more critical of the modeling industry and its unrealistic beauty standards.

options.label: B
options.text: She wants them to be more accepting of the modeling industry and its flaws.

options.label: C
options.text: She wants them to be more aware of the power of image and its impact on our lives, including the way it shapes our perceptions of beauty and self-worth.

options.label: D
options.text: She wants them to be more dismissive of the modeling industry.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the current state of diversity in the modeling industry?

options.label: A
options.text: It's very diverse, with many models of color and a wide range of body types.

options.label: B
options.text: It's still lacking diversity, with many models of color facing barriers to entry and success, and a narrow definition of beauty that excludes many people.

options.label: C
options.text: The industry is making progress, but there is still more work to be done.

options.label: D
options.text: The speaker does not comment on the state of diversity in the industry.

multiple-choice.question: How does the speaker describe her own position in the modeling industry?

options.label: A
options.text: She's a victim of the modeling industry and its unrealistic beauty standards.

options.label: B
options.text: She's a beneficiary of the modeling industry, having profited from a legacy of beauty standards that favor her physical characteristics.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's final message to her audience?

options.label: A
options.text: She wants them to be more critical of the modeling industry and its flaws.

options.label: B
options.text: She wants them to be more aware of the power of image and its impact on our lives, including the way it shapes our perceptions of beauty and self-worth.

options.label: C
options.text: She wants them to be more accepting of the modeling industry and its flaws.

options.label: D
options.text: She wants them to be more dismissive of the modeling industry.
